summary: This bill, the Foreign Investment Guardrails to Help Thwart (FIGHT) China Act, aims to protect U.S. national security by imposing sanctions on certain Chinese entities and regulating investments by U.S. persons in the People's Republic of China. It defines 'covered foreign persons,' 'prohibited technologies,' and 'covered national security transactions.' The bill mandates reporting to Congress, grants the Secretary of the Treasury significant regulatory powers, and establishes penalties for violations. It also addresses securities and divestment related to the Non-SDN Chinese Military-Industrial Complex Companies List. Furthermore, it encourages multilateral engagement.
